Analysis.name: All-cause mortality. Worst-best case scenario sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "the computer-generated randomization and patient allocation were performed by the research pharmacist without any stratification and using a block factor of 4, which was unknown to investigators." Quote: "Baseline clinical characteristics, including diabetes, dyslipidemia, and hypertension medication use, were similar in all groups."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Quote: "randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled." Quote: "The primary analysis was an intentionto-treat comparison".
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 8/32 missing data in placebo group and 3/36 missing data in vitamin E group. No analysis methods that correct for bias, nor sensitivity analyses were stated. There is an imbalance between numbers and reasons for missing data which could mean that missingness could be related to true outcome. There were documented reasons for discontinuations and the reported reasons were unrelated to the outcome data, so it is not likely that missingness in the outcome depended on its true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. It was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: "randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled"
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: All-cause mortality. Worst-best case scenario sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "Eligible patients were randomized in permuted blocks of treatments stratified by clinical center." Quote: "Baseline characteristics were similar for all 3 treatment groups with respect to demographics, anthropometrics, quality-of-life assessments, pertinent laboratory data, and liver histology."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Quote: "randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, placebo-controlled clinical trial." Quote: "All patients were evaluated on an intention-to-treat basis."
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 11/58 missing data in placebo group and 8/58 missing data in vitamin E group. No analysis methods that correct for bias, nor sensitivity analyses were stated. There is an imbalance between numbers and reasons for missing data which could mean that missingness could be related to true outcome. There were documented reasons for discontinuations and the reported reasons were unrelated to the outcome data, so it is not likely that missingness in the outcome depended on its true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. The outcome was death, and it was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: "randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, placebo-controlled clinical trial."
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: All-cause mortality. Worst-best case scenario sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "the randomization plan was prepared and administered centrally by the Data Coordinating Center." Quote: "The three groups were well matched with respect to demographic characteristics, clinical and laboratory data, and activity scores for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Quote: "multi-center, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-masked, double-dummy clinical trial." Quote: "The primary analysis was an intention-to-treat analysis".
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 12/83 missing data in placebo group and 6/84 missing data in vitamin E group. No analysis methods that correct for bias, nor sensitivity analyses were stated. There is an imbalance between numbers and reasons for missing data which could mean that missingness could be related to true outcome. There were documented reasons for discontinuations and the reported reasons were unrelated to the outcome data, so it is not likely that missingness in the outcome depended on its true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. The outcome was death, and it was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: "multi-center, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-masked, double-dummy clinical trial."
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: The protocol was epubed on Sep 10 2008, and the actual primary completion date was June 2009, so it is likely that the analysis plan was published before unblinded outcome data was available to the triallists. But the relevant intentions were not available in sufficient detail.
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: Imaging response. Proportion of participants without a normal ultrasound (range from 5 months to 12 months)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "A permuted block design was employed. Each block of specified size contained allocation ratio of 1:1 (placebo:tocotrienols). The random allocation sequence would select the next block and determine the next allocations. Sequence was not made known to researchers who enrolled participants. For the purpose of assigning participants to interventions, a subject number was used. the researcher (WJW) who generated the random allocation sequence and assigned participants was blinded to subjects' clinical data and was independent from the persons who enrolled participants." Quote: "The two groups of enrolled subjects were found to be homogeneous with regard to baseline characteristics"

Analysis.name: Imaging response. Proportion of participants without a normal ultrasound (range from 5 months to 12 months)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

Quote: “Block Randomization list from an online source: website: www.sealedenvelope.com”, “sealed envelopes method.” Authors reported only baseline characteristics of participants in the final analysis.

Analysis.name: Imaging response. Proportion of participants without a normal ultrasound (range from 5 months to 12 months)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "randomized to receive δ-tocotrienol or placebo through the simple randomization technique by a person not involved in the study". Quote: "The patients in both the groups were comparable at baseline with regard to demographic, anthropometric and biochemical characteristics."

Analysis.name: Imaging response. Proportion of participants without a normal ultrasound (range from 5 months to 12 months)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

Quote: “Randomization was made with the use of sealed envelops containing the treatment assignments.” Quote:"No statistically significant differences existed between the baseline characteristics of the two groups"

Analysis.name: Imaging response. Proportion of participants without a normal ultrasound (12 months)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

Quote: "Patients were randomly assigned to a 12-month double-blind treatment of nutritional counselling plus placebo (group A) or diet plus oral vitamin supplementation [vitamin E 600 IU/day and vitamin C 500 mg/day (group B)]." Quote: “The two arms were balanced for all parameters”

Analysis.name: Serum ALT levels (for profit support)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: “Randomization was performed using a randomization table on the basis of the registration number of the patients (on the order of referral)”, “Study pills were allocated in separate packs blinded and labeled using a four-digit code”. the groups", biochemical markers were not stated and ALT in placebo group was 22.8, while it was 30.7 in the vitamin E group, and it might be arisen by chance.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

Quote: “The information on which codes correspond to what treatment was maintained by the project coordinator. Apart from the project coordinator, the patients, attending physicians, staff involved in the hepatic clinics, and members collecting and analyzing data were blinded to the intervention allocation.” Trialists did not report relevant information. It is likely that no participant was analysed in the wrong intervention group and no participant was excluded from the analysis.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. It was a blood biochemical data, and it was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: “The information on which codes correspond to what treatment was maintained by the project coordinator. Apart from the project coordinator, the patients, attending physicians, staff involved in the hepatic clinics, and members collecting and analyzing data were blinded to the intervention allocation”
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: Serum ALT levels (for profit support)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "the computer-generated randomization and patient allocation were performed by the research pharmacist without any stratification and using a block factor of 4, which was unknown to investigators." Quote: "Baseline clinical characteristics, including diabetes, dyslipidemia, and hypertension medication use, were similar in all groups."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Quote: "randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled." Quote: "The primary analysis was an intention to-treat comparison".
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 8/32 missing data in placebo group and 3/36 missing data in vitamin E group. Quote: "To minimize any potential selection bias as a result of dropouts, different approaches were used to handle missing data (i.e., single and multiple imputation) with similar results." So no analysis methods that correct for bias, nor sensitivity analyses were stated. There is an imbalance between numbers and reasons for missing data which could mean that missingness could be related to true outcome. There were documented reasons for discontinuations and the reported reasons for missing outcome data were similar between groups, so it is not likely that missingness in the outcome depended on its true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. It was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: "randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled"
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: Serum ALT levels (for profit support)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Quote: “randomization was carried out according to balanced block randomization procedure”. No significant differences among intervention groups at study baseline.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Quote: “participants, nutrition specialists, and outcome assessors were all blinded to the interventions into which the individuals were allocated”. Quote: "The data were analyzed according to the intention‑to‑treat principle."
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 63 participants received randomization, 2 participants received no allocated intervention, and 1 discontinued intervention.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. It was a blood biochemical data, and it was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: “participants, nutrition specialists, and outcome assessors were all blinded to the interventions into which the individuals were allocated”.
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: Serum ALT levels (for profit support)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Quote: “using software Random List”, "The study groups were similar regarding their age, sex, BMI, TG, Total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, and hepatic enzyme serum levels."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

It is a double-blind study, and “placebo whose package was similar to vitamin E.” Trialists did not report relevant information. It is likely that no participant was analysed in the wrong intervention group, and no participant was excluded.

Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Quote: "randomized to receive δ-tocotrienol or placebo through the simple randomization technique by a person not involved in the study". Quote: "The patients in both the groups were comparable at baseline with regard to demographic, anthropometric and biochemical characteristics."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Quote: "both the patients and investigators were blinded to treatment allocation…placebo". Analysis was done by intention to treat (ITT).

Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.

Analysis.name: Serum ALT levels (for profit support)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Quote: "the pharmacy established before the start of the study a list randomly assigning each patient to…" Quote: "the medication was delivered by the pharmacy of the lead center (Inselspital, Bern) and shipped regularly to the patients, depending on their requirements…patients as well as their physicians were blinded to the treatment until completion of the whole study" Quote: "The mean serum levels of ALT and AST were elevated in the 3 groups at baseline and not significantly different."
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

Quote: "the medication was delivered by the pharmacy of the lead center (Inselspital, Bern) and shipped regularly to the patients, depending on their requirements…patients as well as their physicians were blinded to the treatment until completion of the whole study." Trialists did not report relevant information. It is likely that no participant was analysed in the wrong intervention group, 1 participant with non-compliance was excluded.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 3/18 missing data in placebo group and 3/15 missing data in vitamin E group. No analysis methods that correct for bias, nor sensitivity analyses were stated. Though numbers of missing data was the same, there is an imbalance between reasons for missing data which could mean that missingness could be related to true outcome. There were documented reasons for discontinuations and the reported reasons were unrelated to the outcome data, so it is not likely that missingness in the outcome depended on its true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: It was a pre-specified outcome. It was likely that same measurement methods and thresholds were used. Quote: "the medication was delivered by the pharmacy of the lead center (Inselspital, Bern) and shipped regularly to the patients, depending on their requirements…patients as well as their physicians were blinded to the treatment until completion of the whole study."
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to raise some concerns in at least one domain for this result, but not to be at high risk of bias for any domain.
